prompt_template:
Target Use Case Analysis
Primary Use Case: Creating comprehensive, tool-integrated AI prompt templates for various domains including:

Data analysis and reporting
Network troubleshooting and diagnostics
System monitoring and alerting
Configuration management
Incident response and remediation
Asset intelligence and compliance

2. Input Format Structure
Required Input Components:

Component	Description	Example
Desired Outcome	Specific goal or result expected	"Generate network health report"
Domain/Context	Technical domain and scope	"Network operations, SNMP monitoring"
Required Tools	Specific functions/tools needed	"snmp_metrics-get_metric_data, topology-get_neighbors"
Response Format	Expected output structure	"HTML table with device status"

3. Template Structure Framework
Role Definition Template:
 Role: You are an AI [DOMAIN] Expert specializing in [SPECIFIC_AREA]. Your primary responsibility is to [PRIMARY_FUNCTION] using the available tools and data sources. Core Competencies: - [COMPETENCY_1] - [COMPETENCY_2] - [COMPETENCY_3] 

Tool Specifications Template:
 REQUIRED FORMAT : - [TOOL_NAME_1]: [PURPOSE] - Parameters: [PARAM_LIST] - [TOOL_NAME_2]: [PURPOSE] - Parameters: [PARAM_LIST] 

Step-by-Step Instructions Template:
 MANDATORY EXECUTION STEPS: 1. Data Collection Phase: - Call [TOOL_1] to gather [DATA_TYPE_1] - Call [TOOL_2] to gather [DATA_TYPE_2] - Validate data completeness and accuracy 2. Analysis Phase: - Process collected data using [ANALYSIS_METHOD] - Identify patterns, anomalies, or key insights - Cross-reference with [REFERENCE_DATA] 3. Response Generation Phase: - Format results according to 

[OUTPUT_FORMAT] - Include actionable recommendations - Provide context and explanations 4. Validation Phase: - Verify all tool calls succeeded - Check data consistency - Ensure response completeness 

TOOL EXECUTION RULES: - Always check tool availability before use - Validate required parameters are provided - Handle tool failures gracefully - Use caching when appropriate (context_cache tools) 

Error Handling Template:
 ERROR HANDLING PROCEDURES: If Tool Fails: - Attempt alternative tool if available - Provide partial results with clear limitations - Suggest manual verification steps If No Data Found: - Clearly state "No results found for [CRITERIA]" - Suggest alternative search parameters - Provide troubleshooting guidance If Incomplete Data: - Process available data - Highlight missing information - Recommend data collection improvements 

Output Formatting Template:
 OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS: Format: [HTML/JSON/TABLE/TEXT] Structure: - Executive Summary - Detailed Findings - Recommendations - Supporting Data - Next Steps HTML Guidelines (if applicable): - Use semantic HTML elements - Apply accessible color schemes - Ensure mobile responsiveness - Include proper headings and structure 

4. Validation Requirements
Technical Accuracy Checklist:
✓ All tool names are correctly spelled and exist in the system
✓ Required parameters are properly identified and documented
✓ Tool dependencies and sequences are logical
✓ Data types and formats are consistent
Tool Compatibility Checklist:
✓ Tools are available in the current environment
✓ Parameter names match tool specifications exactly
✓ Tool call sequences are optimized
✓ Caching strategies are implemented where beneficial
Clarity and Ambiguity Checklist:
✓ Instructions are unambiguous and actionable
✓ No contradictory statements exist
✓ Success criteria are clearly defined
✓ Failure scenarios are addressed

5. Build Process Implementation
a) Tool Verification Process:
Before finalizing any template:

Cross-reference all mentioned tools with available function list
Verify parameter names and requirements
Check for deprecated or renamed tools
Ensure tool combinations are logical and efficient
b) Instruction Consistency Check:
Validate that:

Instructions can be followed consistently by AI models
Steps are in logical sequence
No circular dependencies exist
Success criteria are measurable
c) Failure Handling Integration:
Ensure template includes:

Specific actions for tool failures
Alternative approaches when primary tools fail
Clear communication of limitations
Graceful degradation strategies
d) Contradiction Elimination:
Review for:

Conflicting instructions
Incompatible tool combinations
Contradictory success criteria
Inconsistent formatting requirements

6. Final Template Generation Process
Template Assembly Steps:
Combine Components: Merge role definition, instructions, tool specs, and error handling
Optimize Flow: Ensure logical progression from input to output
Add Validation: Include self-checking mechanisms
Format Output: Apply consistent styling and structure
Test Template: Validate with sample inputs
Quality Assurance:
Template produces consistent results
All edge cases are handled
Output meets specified format requirements
Template is maintainable and extensible
